project.name: CloudKid OS API
project.description: CloudKid OS API: A framework for HTML5 content built on top of createjs

params.name: width
params.description: The screen width in pixels

params.name: height
params.description: The screen height in pixels

params.name: ppi
params.description: The screen pixel density (PPI)

BitmapUtils (CreateJS).name: BitmapUtils (CreateJS)
BitmapUtils (CreateJS).description: [CreateJS only] Designed to provide utility related to Bitmaps.

Button (CreateJS).name: Button (CreateJS)
Button (CreateJS).description:
A Multipurpose button class. It is designed to have one image, and an optional text label.
The button can be a normal button or a selectable button.
The button functions similarly with both CreateJS and PIXI, but slightly differently in
initialization and callbacks. Add event listeners for click and mouseover to know about 
button clicks and mouse overs, respectively.

params.name: imageSettings
params.description:
Information about the art to be used for button states, as well as if the button is selectable or not.
       If this is an Image or Canvas element, then the button assumes that the image is full width and 3 images
       tall, in the order (top to bottom) up, over, down. If so, then the properties of imageSettings are ignored.

props.name: image
props.description: The image to use for all of the button states.

props.name: priority
props.description:
The state priority order. If omitted, defaults to ["disabled", "down", "over", "up"].
       Previous versions of Button used a hard coded order: ["highlighted", "disabled", "down", "over", "selected", "up"].

props.name: up
props.description: The visual information about the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
       trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data 
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: over
props.description: The visual information about the over state. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
       trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data 
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: down
props.description: The visual information about the down state. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
       trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data 
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: disabled
props.description: The visual information about the disabled state. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
       trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override 
       data in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: <yourCustomState>
props.description:
The visual information about a custom state found in imageSettings.priority.
       Any state added this way has a property of the same name added to the button. Examples of previous states that have been
       moved to this system are "selected" and "highlighted".

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels 
       were trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter 
       override data in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be
       overridden.

props.name: origin
props.description:
An optional offset for all button graphics, in case you want button 
       positioning to not include a highlight glow, or any other reason you would want to offset the button art and label.

params.name: label
params.description: Information about the text label on the button. Omitting this makes the button not use a label.

props.name: text
props.description: The text to display on the label.

props.name: font
props.description: The font name and size to use on the label, as createjs.Text expects.

props.name: color
props.description: The color of the text to use on the label, as createjs.Text expects.

props.name: textBaseline
props.description: The baseline for the label text, as createjs.Text expects.

props.name: stroke
props.description: The stroke to use for the label text, if desired, as createjs.Text (CloudKid fork only) expects.

props.name: shadow
props.description: A shadow object to apply to the label text.

props.name: x
props.description:
An x position to place the label text at relative to the button. If omitted,
       "center" is used, which attempts to horizontally center the label on the button.

props.name: y
props.description:
A y position to place the label text at relative to the button. If omitted,
       "center" is used, which attempts to vertically center the label on the button. This may be unreliable -
       see documentation for createjs.Text.getMeasuredLineHeight().

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether or not the button is initially enabled.

DragManager (CreateJS).name: DragManager (CreateJS)
DragManager (CreateJS).description:
Drag manager is responsible for handling the dragging of stage elements.
Supports click-n-stick (click to start, move mouse, click to release) and click-n-drag (standard dragging) functionality.

params.name: startCallback
params.description: The callback when when starting

params.name: endCallback
params.description: The callback when ending

FunctionUtils (CreateJS).name: FunctionUtils (CreateJS)
FunctionUtils (CreateJS).description: [CreateJS only] Designed to provide utility related to functions and polyfills

CacheManager.name: CacheManager
CacheManager.description:
Used for managing the browser cache of loading external elements
can easily load version manifest and apply it to the media loader
supports cache busting all media load requests
uses the query string to bust browser versions.

LoaderQueueItem.name: LoaderQueueItem
LoaderQueueItem.description: Represents a single item in the loader queue

MediaLoader.name: MediaLoader
MediaLoader.description:
The Medialoader is the singleton loader for loading all assets
including images, data, code and sounds. MediaLoader supports cache-busting
in the browser using dynamic query string parameters.

MediaLoaderResult.name: MediaLoaderResult
MediaLoaderResult.description: The return result of the MediaLoader load

params.name: content
params.description: The dynamic content loaded

AssetManager (PIXI).name: AssetManager (PIXI)
AssetManager (PIXI).description:
[PIXI-only] Asset Manager is responsible for managing different resolutions of assets and spritesheets
based on the resolution of the stage. This is a helpful optimization for PIXI which some low-hardware
devices have a problem keeping up with.

Button (PIXI).name: Button (PIXI)
Button (PIXI).description:
A Multipurpose button class. It is designed to have one image, and an optional text label.
The button can be a normal button or a selectable button.
The button functions similarly with both CreateJS and PIXI, but slightly differently in
initialization and callbacks.
Use releaseCallback and overCallback to know about button clicks and mouse overs, respectively.

params.name: imageSettings
params.description: Information about the art to be used for button states, as well as if the button is selectable or not.

props.name: up
props.description: The texture for the up state of the button.

props.name: over
props.description: The texture for the over state of the button. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: down
props.description: The texture for the down state of the button. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: disabled
props.description: The texture for the disabled state of the button. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: highlighted
props.description: The texture for the highlighted state of the button. If omitted, uses the over state.

props.name: selected
props.description: The texture for the selected state of the button. If omitted, the button is not a selectable button.

props.name: scale
props.description: The scale to use for the textures. This allows smaller art assets than the designed size to be used.

params.name: label
params.description: Information about the text label on the button. Omitting this makes the button not use a label.

props.name: type
props.description: If label.type is "bitmap", then a PIXI.BitmapText text is created, otherwise a PIXI.Text is created for the label.

props.name: text
props.description: The text to display on the label.

props.name: style
props.description: The style of the text field, in the format that PIXI.BitmapText and PIXI.Text expect.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether or not the button is initially enabled.

DragManager (PIXI).name: DragManager (PIXI)
DragManager (PIXI).description:
Drag manager is responsible for handling the dragging of stage elements
supports click-n-stick and click-n-drag functionality.

params.name: startCallback
params.description: The callback when when starting

params.name: endCallback
params.description: The callback when ending

ScreenSettings.name: ScreenSettings
ScreenSettings.description: Object that contains the screen settings to help scaling

UIElement.name: UIElement
UIElement.description: A single UI item that needs to be resized

UIElementSettings.name: UIElementSettings
UIElementSettings.description: The UI Item Settings which is the positioning settings used to adjust each element

UIScaler.name: UIScaler
UIScaler.description:
The UI scale is responsible for scaling UI components
to help easy the burden of different device aspect ratios

Application.name: Application
Application.description:
An application is an abstract class which extends `createjs.Container`
and is managed by the `cloudkid.OS`

CombinedCallback.name: CombinedCallback

params.name: call
params.description: The callback to call when everything is complete.

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to check as an additional completion dependency.

params.name: prop
params.description: The property to check on obj. If obj[prop] is false, then it is considered complete.

params.name: callProp
params.description: The property to set on obj if obj[prop] is true when the CombinedCallback is called.

OS.name: OS
OS.description:
Designed to mimic the feature-set of the CloudKidOS for AS3
Provides a staging framework for other things to load
handles the stage query string parameters, provides debug tools,
as well as browser cache-busting.

SavedData.name: SavedData
SavedData.description: The SavedData functions use localStorage and sessionStorage, with a cookie fallback.

Worker.name: Worker

SubWorker.name: SubWorker
SubWorker.description: Internal class that pretends to be a Web Worker's context.

params.name: codeString
params.description: A string to evaluate into worker code.

params.name: parent
params.description: The FallbackWorker that owns this SubWorker.

FallbackWorker.name: FallbackWorker
FallbackWorker.description: An internal class that duplicates the Worker API as a fallback when WebWorkers are not supported.

params.name: codeString
params.description: A string to evaluate into worker code.

classitems.description: Replaces Bitmaps in the global lib dictionary with a version that pulls the image from a spritesheet.
classitems.name: loadSpriteSheet

params.name: frameDict
params.description:
A dictionary of frame information, with frame, trimmed, 
	and spriteSourceSize properties (like the JSON hash output from TexturePacker).

params.name: spritesheetImage
params.description: The spritesheet image that contains all of the frames.

params.name: scale
params.description:
The scale to apply to all sprites from the spritesheet. 
	For example, a half sized spritesheet should have a scale of 2.

classitems.description:
Replaces Bitmaps in the global lib dictionary with a version that uses a scaled bitmap, so you can load up
smaller bitmaps behind the scenes that are scaled back up to normal size.
classitems.name: replaceWithScaledBitmap

params.name: idOrDict
params.description: A dictionary of Bitmap ids to replace, or a single id.

params.name: scale
params.description: The scale to apply to the image(s).

classitems.description:
The sprite that is the body of the button.
The type of this property is dependent on which version of the OS library is used.
classitems.name: back

classitems.description:
The text field of the button. The label is centered by both width and height on the button.
The type of this property is dependent on which version of the OS library is used.

classitems.description: A dictionary of state booleans, keyed by state name.
classitems.name: _stateFlags

classitems.description:
An array of state names (Strings), in their order of priority.
The standard order previously was ["highlighted", "disabled", "down", "over", "selected", "up"].
classitems.name: _statePriority

classitems.description:
A dictionary of state graphic data, keyed by state name.
Each object contains the sourceRect (src) and optionally 'trim', another Rectangle.
Additionally, each object will contain a 'label' object if the button has a text label.
classitems.name: _stateFlags

classitems.description: The width of the button art, independent of the scaling of the button itself.
classitems.name: _width

classitems.description: The height of the button art, independent of the scaling of the button itself.

classitems.description: An offset to button positioning, generally used to adjust for a highlight around the button.

Adds a property to the button. Setting the property sets the value in
_stateFlags and calls _updateState().

The callback for when the button for when the mouse/touch is released on the button
- only when the button was held down initially.

classitems.description: Generates a desaturated up state as a disabled state, and an update with a solid colored glow for a highlighted state.
classitems.name: generateDefaultStates

params.name: image
params.description: The image to use for all of the button states, in the standard up/over/down format.

params.name: disabledSettings
params.description: The settings object for the disabled state. If omitted, no disabled state is created.

props.name: saturation
props.description:
The saturation adjustment for the disabled state. 
       100 is fully saturated, 0 is unchanged, -100 is desaturated.

props.name: brightness
props.description:
The brightness adjustment for the disabled state. 
       100 is fully bright, 0 is unchanged, -100 is completely dark.

props.name: contrast
props.description:
The contrast adjustment for the disabled state. 
       100 is full contrast, 0 is unchanged, -100 is no contrast.

params.name: highlightSettings
params.description: The settings object for the highlight state. If omitted, no state is created.

props.name: size
props.description: How many pixels to make the glow, eg 8 for an 8 pixel increase on each side.

props.name: red
props.description: The red value for the glow, from 0 to 255.

props.name: green
props.description: The green value for the glow, from 0 to 255.

props.name: blue
props.description: The blue value for the glow, from 0 to 255.

props.name: alpha
props.description: The alpha value for the glow, from 0 to 255, with 0 being transparent and 255 fully opaque.

classitems.description: Simple clamp function

Adds properties and functions to the object - use enableDrag() and disableDrag() on 
objects to enable/disable them (they start out disabled). Properties added to objects:
_dragBounds (Rectangle), _onMouseDownListener (Function), _dragMan (cloudkid.DragManager) reference to the DragManager
these will override any existing properties of the same name

       is an object with keys of "titleSafe", "minScale", "maxScale", "centerHorizontally", "align"

params.description: The horizontal align of the item (default is center)

params.description: The minimum scale amount (default, scales the same size as the stage)

params.description: The maximum scale amount (default, scales the same size as the stage)

params.name: centeredHorizontally
params.description: Makes sure that the center of the object was at the center of the screen, assuming an origin at the top left of the object

params.description: The callback to call when everything is complete.

params.description: The object to check as an additional completion dependency.

params.name: prop
params.description: The property to check on obj. If obj[prop] is false, then it is considered complete.

params.name: callProp
params.description: The property to set on obj if obj[prop] is true when the CombinedCallback is called.

classitems.description: Static constructor for setting up the stage
classitems.name: init

params.name: stageName
params.description: The stage name selector

params.name: options
params.description: Additional options

props.name: mouseOverRate
props.description: (CreateJS only) the framerate for mouseover effects, higher is more responsive

props.name: debug
props.description: If we should enable the Debug class for doing console and remote logs

props.name: minLogLevel
props.description: The minimum log level for the Debug class, default is show all statements, values from 0 (all)-4 (errors only)

props.name: ip
props.description: The IP address for doing remote debugging

props.name: parseQueryString
props.description: If we should convert the query string into OS options

props.name: showFramerate
props.description: To display the current framerate counter

props.name: clearView
props.description: Auto clear the stage render

props.name: backgroundColor
props.description: (PIXI only) The background color of the stage as a uint, e.g. 0xFFFFFF for white.

props.name: preMultAlpha
props.description: (PIXI only) If the renderer is to use pre multiplied alpha for all images. This only affects the WebGL renderer.

props.name: transparent
props.description: (PIXI only) The stage is transparent

props.name: width
props.description: (PIXI only) The width of the renderer, default is the canvas width

props.name: height
props.description: (PIXI only) The height of the renderer, default is the canvas height

props.name: forceContext
props.description: (PIXI only) The stage renderer, options are "canvas2d", "webgl" or null. Omitting this (or null) uses WebGL if available, and Canvas2D otherwise.

props.name: raf
props.description: Use the request animation frame instead of a setInterval

props.name: fps
props.description: Set the framerate

props.name: versionsFile
props.description: The text field to store cache-busting versions for individual files

props.name: basePath
props.description: The base path to load all files from (useful if using a CDN)

props.name: cacheBust
props.description: If all file requests with the MediaLoader should be cacheBusted (e.g., "file.mp3?cb=123123")
